Title: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back
Review: The Empire Strikes Back deftly delivers Lucas’s creativity, Kershner’s technical know-how, more rounded characters than its predecessor, and ground-breaking storytelling. And for such, it stands as not only an excellent Star Wars movie and a great sequel, but as one of the best movies ever made.

Title: Episode IV - A New Hope
Review: Its influence has made it tame and almost cliche, but despite its age, A New Hope is a masterpiece of storytelling and ingenuity. There should be no question why it was able to impact so many people and so many films.

Title: Episode VIII - The Last Jedi
Review: The Last Jedi is perhaps the most thematically resonant of all the Star Wars films. It manages this accolade alongside some genuine surprises, lovely cinematography, and impressive action. Though it is certainly flawed, it makes for a more interesting installment than The Force Awakens.

Title: Episode VII - The Force Awakens
Review: There's no doubt that this movie borrows a lot from its predecessors, but I think the widespread love for this blockbuster flick is a testament to its impressive new characters and its fun and engaging tone.

Title: Episode III - Revenge of the Sith
Review: This is the highpoint of the prequels, delivering the emotion and motivation that the previous two lacked.

Title: Episode VI - Return of the Jedi
Review: By merit of its final act and its place in the original trilogy, this movie is able to transcend some major disadvantages.

Title: Solo: A Star Wars Story
Review: Though the humor is lacking and the acting uneven, the propulsive plot is one of the best in the franchise and the movie is still admittedly good.

Title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story
Review: The last act and the fan-fare Vader scene are excellent, but as a whole, the movie is flat and poorly-paced and the characters are unlikable.

Title: Episode I - The Phantom Menace
Review: While the Phantom Menace is certainly flawed, its main asset is its world-building and the sheer creativity at display in Lucas’s plot.

Title: Episode II - Attack of the Clones
Review: This is the lowest point of the franchise, largely due to the flat acting and writing.
